thread.title: The Man Who Took KKR's Stock for a Ride
thread.title_full: The Man Who Took KKR's Stock for a Ride

title: The Man Who Took KKR's Stock for a Ride
text:
Markets The Man Who Took KKR’s Stock for a Ride KKR is considering replacing its market-making firm after it failed to adequately explain its floor trader’s decisions that for a brief time on Aug. 24 cut the private-equity firm’s market value in half. By andrew.ackerman@wsj.com Sept. 18, 2015 5:33 a.m. ET 
In the five years since KKR & Co. listed on the New York Stock Exchange, the private-equity firm’s executives have barely thought about the person on the trading floor who sometimes facilitates the buying and selling of its shares. 
Now, this role has become a focal point at the company. 
KKR is considering replacing its market-making firm, IMC Financial Markets. KKR says IMC failed to adequately explain its floor trader’s... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Popular on WSJ
